briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Returns the state space dimension.
Returns the control space dimension.
Computes the system dynamics.

detaileddescription.para:
It return $ f(t,x) $. Notice that here the dependency from the control input is removed, so that basically we are assuming an autonomous system. If the system is controlled, the control input will be set separately with the method setControlInput. This was necessary since the Integrator class needs an autonomous system to be integrated. See ControlledDynamicalSystem class in case you want to join a DynamicalSystem with a Controller.
state
The state point in which the dynamics is computed.
time
The time at which the dynamics is computed.
stateDynamics
The value of the state derivative.
True if successfull.

briefdescription.para: Set the control input to the dynamical system.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This value is stored in an internal buffer which can be accessed through the method controlInput().
control
The control input value.
True if successful, false otherwise (for example if size do not match).

briefdescription.para: Access the control input.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This has to be set with the method setControlInput().
Const reference to the control input buffer.

briefdescription.para: Access the control input.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This has to be set with the method setControlInput().
index
Index at which accessing the control input buffer.
Value corresponding to the specified index.

briefdescription.para: Access the initial state.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This has to be set with the method setInitialState().
Const reference to the initial state buffer.

briefdescription.para: Access the initial state.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This has to be set with the method setInitialState().
index
Index at which accessing the initial state buffer.
Value corresponding to the specified index.

briefdescription.para: Set the initial state to the dynamical system.

detaileddescription.para:
In principle, there is no need to override this method. This value is stored in an internal buffer which can be accessed through the method initialState().
state
The initial state value.
True if successful, false otherwise (for example if size do not match).

briefdescription.para: Compute the partial derivative of the state dynamics wrt the state.

detaileddescription.para: Namely it computes, $ \frac{\partial f(t,x,u)}{\partial x}$. By default it return false;

parameterdescription.para: The state value at which computing the partial derivative.
The time at which computing the partial derivative.
The output derivative. It has to be a square matrix with dimension equal to the state size.

simplesect.para: True if successful, false otherwise (or if not implemented).

briefdescription.para: Compute the partial derivative of the state dynamics wrt the control.

detaileddescription.para: Namely it computes, $ \frac{\partial f(t,x,u)}{\partial u}$. By default it return false;

parameterdescription.para: The state value at which computing the partial derivative.
The time at which computing the partial derivative.
The output derivative. It has to be a matrix with number of rows equal to the state size and number of columns equal to the control size.

simplesect.para: True if successful, false otherwise (or if not implemented).

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of nonzeros elements in terms of row and colun index, in the state jacobian.

parameterdescription.para: Sparsity structure of the partial derivative of the jacobian wrt state variables.

simplesect.para: true if the sparsity is available. False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of nonzeros elements in terms of row and colun index, in the control jacobian.

parameterdescription.para: Sparsity structure of the partial derivative of the jacobian wrt state variables.

simplesect.para: true if the sparsity is available. False otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (double time, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &state, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &lambda, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &partialDerivative)
memberdef.name: dynamicsSecondPartialDerivativeWRTState

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the dynamics second partial derivative wrt the state variables.

detaileddescription.para:
It is the result of $\frac{\partial^2 f(t, x, u)}{\partial x^2}$
time
The time at which the partial derivative is computed.
state
The state value at which the partial derivative is computed.
lambda
The associated lagrange multipliers
partialDerivative
The output partial derivative.
True if successfull, false otherwise (or if not implemented).

memberdef.argsstring: (double time, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &state, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &lambda, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &partialDerivative)
memberdef.name: dynamicsSecondPartialDerivativeWRTControl

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the dynamics second partial derivative wrt the control.

detaileddescription.para:
It is the result of $\frac{\partial^2 f(t, x, u)}{\partial u^2}$
time
The time at which the partial derivative is computed.
state
The state value at which the partial derivative is computed.
lambda
The associated lagrange multipliers
partialDerivative
The output partial derivative.
True if successfull, false otherwise (or if not implemented).

memberdef.argsstring: (double time, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &state, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &lambda, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &partialDerivative)
memberdef.name: dynamicsSecondPartialDerivativeWRTStateControl

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the dynamics second partial derivative wrt the state and control.

detaileddescription.para:
It is the result of $\frac{\partial^2 f(t, x, u)}{\partial x \partial u}$, thus it has number of rows equals to the number of states and number of cols equal to the number of control inputs.
time
The time at which the partial derivative is computed.
state
The state value at which the partial derivative is computed.
lambda
The associated lagrange multipliers
partialDerivative
The output partial derivative.
True if successfull, false otherwise (or if not implemented).

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of nonzeros elements in terms of row and colun index, in the state hessian.

simplesect.para: No check is performed in the indeces. They need to be in the range [0, stateDimension) and [0, stateDimension) respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Sparsity structure of the partial derivative of the jacobian wrt state variables.

simplesect.para: true if the sparsity is available. False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of nonzeros elements in terms of row and colun index, in the mixed hessian.

simplesect.para: No check is performed in the indeces. They need to be in the range [0, stateDimension) and [0, controlDimension) respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Sparsity structure of the partial derivative of the jacobian wrt state and control variables.

simplesect.para: true if the sparsity is available. False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of nonzeros elements in terms of row and colun index, in the control hessian.

simplesect.para: No check is performed in the indeces. They need to be in the range [0, constraintDimension) and [0, controlDimension) respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Sparsity structure of the partial derivative of the jacobian wrt control variables.

simplesect.para: true if the sparsity is available. False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: DynamicalSystem base class.

detaileddescription.para:
This class is still in active development, and so API interface can change between iDynTree versions.
It defines a continuos time dynamical system, i.e. $ \dot{x} = f(t,x,u) $ Inherit publicly from this class in order to define your custiom dynamical system.
